sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Access control policy; system</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>If wireless access is explicitly approved, the information system protects wireless access to the system using encryption, and authentication of both users and devices.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Access Control">408779fcdb211010280df36f29961977</control_family> <control_name>Authentication and Encryption</control_name> <control_number>AC-18(01)</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory Enhancement</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AC-18</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010844</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:21</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; NIST SP: 800-97, 800-153</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-3, IA-2, IA-3, IA-8, SC-8, SC-13</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Ensuring wireless connections use authentication and encryption reduces the risk that an unauthorized device or user will gain access to the system or intercept communications.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Communication over wireless networks, unless properly secured, has a greater risk of interception than hard-wired networks. Implementing encryption of wireless network communications containing personally identifiable information (PII) renders any intercepted data unreadable.If wireless networks permit access to organization information systems containing PII, then encryption of content and authentication of users or devices is required. Organizations should ensure that all WLAN components use FIPS-approved cryptographic algorithms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of WLAN communications.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>d887b9fcdb211010280df36f29961938</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
